text.text_translated: The Hunger Games are an annual event. The Capitol uses the games to make the areas obey. Each year Capitol picks a boy and a girl from each area. They are aged twelve to eighteen. The choice is made by a draw. The chosen teenagers are called tributes. The tributes must fight in a match. Only one tribute can stay alive. The whole country watches the games on TV.

best_attempt.text_translated:
The Hunger Games happen every year.  
The Capitol uses the games to punish the districts.  
Each district picks one boy and one girl, aged 12 to 18.  
A lottery chooses them.  
These teenagers are called tributes.  
The tributes must fight in a match.  
Only one tribute can stay alive.  
The whole nation must watch the games on television.
